sen.j: 大念寺（だいねんじ）は京都府乙訓郡大山崎町にある浄土宗の仏教寺院。
sen.e: Dainen-ji Temple is a Buddhist temple belonging to the Pure Land Sect located in Oyamazaki-cho, Otokuni County, Kyoto Prefecture.
Dainen-ji Temple is a Buddhist temple belonging to the Pure Land Sect located in Oyamazaki-cho, Otokuni County, Kyoto Prefecture.
Dainen-ji Temple is a Buddhist temple belonging to the Pure Land Sect located in Oyamazaki-cho, Otokuni-gun, Kyoto Prefecture.
Its honorific mountain prefix is Mihotokezan.
Its honorific mountain prefix is Mihotokezan.
Its sango (literally, "mountain name"), which is the title prefixed to the name of a Buddhist temple, is Mihotokezan.

sen.j: 天王山の山麓、宝積寺のすぐ下に位置する。
sen.e: The temple is situated at the foot of Mt. Tennozan, below Hoshaku-ji Temple.
The temple is situated at the foot of Mt. Tennozan, below Hoshaku-ji Temple.
The temple is situated at the foot of Mt. Tenno, below Hoshaku-ji Temple.

sen.j: 室町時代後期の弘治 (日本)元年（1555年）、井尻但馬守長助による開基、開山は知恩院から招いた徳誉光然である。
sen.e: Dainen-ji Temple was founded in 1555 during the latter part of the Muromachi period by the kaiki (founding patron) Ijiri Tajimanokami Chosuke and kaizan (founding priest) Tokuyo Konen who was invited from Chion-in Temple.

Dainen-ji Temple was founded in 1555 during the latter part of the Muromachi period by the kaiki (founding patron) Ijiri Tajimanokami Chosuke and kaizan (founding priest) Tokuyo Konen who was invited from Chion-in Temple.

Dainen-ji Temple was founded in 1555 during the latter part of the Muromachi period by the kaiki (founding patron) Ijiri Tajimanokami Chosuke and kaizan (founding priest) Tokuyo Konen who was invited from Chion-in Temple.

sen.j: 堂宇は禁門の変で兵火を受けて焼失したが、その後再建されて現在に至る。
sen.e: The temple halls were destroyed by fire during the Hamaguri Rebellion but were soon rebuilt and survive to today.
The temple halls were destroyed by fire during the Hamaguri Rebellion but were soon rebuilt and survive to today.
The temple halls were destroyed by fire during the Hamaguri Rebellion but were soon rebuilt and survive to today.

sen.j: 木造阿弥陀如来立像 - 重要文化財、鎌倉時代、仁治4年（1243年）
sen.e: Wooden standing statue of Amida Nyorai: Designated an Important Cultural Property and created in 1243 during the Kamakura period
Wooden standing statue of Amida Nyorai: Designated an Important Cultural Property and created in 1243 during the Kamakura period
Wooden standing statue of Amida Nyorai: Designated an Important Cultural Property and created in 1243 during the Kamakura period

sen.j: 六角形石灯籠 - 桃山時代（1584年の銘）
sen.e: A hexagonal stone garden lantern: Created during the Momoyama period (inscribed 1584)
A hexagonal stone garden lantern: Created during the Momoyama period (inscribed 1584)
A hexagonal stone garden lantern: Created during the Momoyama period (inscribed 1584)

sen.j: 〒618-0071 大山崎町字大山崎小字上ノ田69番地
sen.e: 69 Koaza Uenota, Oyamazaki, Oyamazaki-cho, Kyoto Prefecture 618-0071

sen.j: 阪急京都本線 大山崎駅 徒歩15分
sen.e: 15 minutes walk from Oyamazaki Station on the Hankyu Kyoto Main Line.
15 minutes walk from Oyamazaki Station on the Hankyu Kyoto Main Line.

sen.j: JR京都線 山崎駅 (京都府) 徒歩15分
sen.e: 15 minutes walk from Yamazaki Station (Kyoto Prefecture) on the JR Kyoto Line.
